channel.title: What is the most interesting thing you know?
channel.description: Your peripheral vision is largely, if not entirely, black and white. Your brain fills in what colors it thinks should be there.

item.title: What is the most interesting thing you know?
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

en.wikipedia.org

Geomagnetic reversal

A geomagnetic reversal is a change in a planet's magnetic field such that the positions of magnetic north and magnetic south are interchanged, while geographic north and geographic south remain the same. The Earth's field has alternated between periods of normal polarity, in which the predominant direction of the field was the same as the present direction, and reverse polarity, in which it was the opposite. These periods are called chrons. The time spans of chrons are randomly distributed with m...

Supposedly we are due around now, which leads idiots to ‘hurrrr polar reversal 2012 end of the world durrrr’

Read full topic

item.title: What is the most interesting thing you know?
item.dc:creator: @shrogg shrogg
item.description:
@shrogg wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:5, topic:427997”][quote author=Cole1497 link=topic=530690.msg3875649#msg3875649 date=1325647902]
Your peripheral vision is largely, if not entirely, black and white. Your brain fills in what colors it thinks should be there.
[/quote]
But we humans do not think alike
Most interesting thing or rather mysterious thing to me is
Water, yet it is colourless and tasteless, why do we need it?
We desire it… Yet nothing is pure like water[/quote]
It cools our body’s, For sweat, producing fluids to excrete from various cavity’s from your body (Spit, tears, brain fluid shit)

item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

There is a third type of matter other then dark and light, that acts as a buffer between the two.

If one atom of dark matter ever touched normal matter it would make an explosion the size of newyork.

item.title: What is the most interesting thing you know?
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

[quote="`Alec, post:13, topic:428011"][quote author=amy_webb link=topic=530690.msg3879364#msg3879364 date=1325908866]
Then explain how people don’t remember things from their childhood? Even if they are told what happened they still cannot remember, and if you can’t see how i was joking then you must be the idiot.

You didn’t prevent it from derailing so that puts you at fault too.
[/quote]

Some people have bad memory? Also, they’re most likely remembering it but not thinking about it. No, I can’t see how you were joking. Explain to me how making a joke about people not using 80% of their brain is funny. I am interested.

As to the last sentence: “I did shoot you in the gut, but you didn’t prevent the blood from spewing out so therefore you’re to blame for the fact that you bled out”.

Done arguing, it’s getting late.[/quote]
Already explained how it was a joke, obviously you weren’t paying attention.

As for “I did shoot you in the gut, but you didn’t prevent the blood from spewing out so therefore you’re to blame for the fact that you bled out” it would have been their fault for not preventing them shooting the person, now if you want to take it any further pm me because this topic doesn’t need any more derailing.

Read full topic

item.title: What is the most interesting thing you know?
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

[quote="`Alec, post:10, topic:428011"][quote author=amy_webb link=topic=530690.msg3879335#msg3879335 date=1325906908]
Why? Would it make you butthurt? Also that’s a pathetic comment, being brittish or aussie doesn’t make you any different from the rest of the world. I take it you’re the kind of person who agrees with slave labor?

When i said 99% that was a JOKE and then i said ‘like’ so i wasn’t being a stuck up know it all like yourself, good day sir.
[/quote]

Being British does make you different from the rest of the world, just as being Asian makes you different, being Italian makes you different, being French makes you different, need I say more?

Uhh I don’t agree with slave labor. I don’t know how the fuck you can draw that conclusion from me saying “I won’t lose an argument to a brit”. I typically wouldn’t want to lose an argument with anyone in particular (would you?). Possibly the reason I don’t want to lose an argument to you is because you can’t accept the fact that you said something extremely incorrect, to which I corrected you, to which you claimed you were just kidding about the whole thing.[/quote]
Then why say you wouldn’t want to lose one to a ‘brit/aussie’, it just shows you find us lower then yourself by putting it the way you did. Africans were used for slave labor and because you obviously think certain races have less value then others. Stating you don’t want to lose an arguement just shows you’re too head strong to admit somethings you say aren’t right, and i actually did have correct information in there. 10% of the human brain is USED, storage does not count because most forget memories.

Read full topic

item.title: What is the most interesting thing you know?
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

[quote="`Alec, post:9, topic:428011"][quote author=amy_webb link=topic=530690.msg3879323#msg3879323 date=1325906192]

So you call me an idiot because of that? It was a joke mate, get your head out of your arse.

[im g]http://memegenerator.net/cache/instances/400x/12/12650/12953693.jpg[/img]

Yep, you’re a funny one. You can tell by the content in my text that it wasn’t a perfectly detailed response.
[/quote]

Actually, I just knew that you were using some trite excuse for being an idiot. I didn’t infer from the “content in your text”, I inferred from the fact that that would be a terrible joke (if it is one). It certainly isn’t sarcasm or trolling either, so don’t try and use that. Nobody trolls about brain accessibility.

I refuse to lose an argument to some brit/aussie.[/quote]
Why? Would it make you butthurt? Also that’s a pathetic comment, being brittish or aussie doesn’t make you any different from the rest of the world. I take it you’re the kind of person who agrees with slave labor?

99% of that isn’t accessable by the regular human. Actually like 80% isn’t, some pople have been known ot use 10% or more but not everyone does.

When i said 99% that was a JOKE and then i said ‘like’ so i wasn’t being a stuck up know it all like yourself, good day sir.

Read full topic
